#!/bin/bash
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
# é¸½æ¢¦AI - macOS æ‰“åŒ…è„šæœ¬ï¼ˆæ”¯æŒæ­£å¼ç‰ˆ / ä½“éªŒç‰ˆï¼‰

set -euo pipefail

APP_NAME="é¸½æ¢¦Godream"

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
PACKAGING_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR"
BUILD_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/build"
DIST_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/dist"
DMG_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/dmg_build"
RESOURCES_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/edition/resources"
RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR=""
TEMP_ICON_DIR=""

detect_version() {
    python3 -c "import runpy, pathlib; version_path=pathlib.Path(r'''$PROJECT_ROOT''')/'version.py'; data=runpy.run_path(str(version_path)) if version_path.exists() else {}; print(data.get('__version__','0.0.0'))"
}

APP_VERSION="$(detect_version)"

usage() {
    cat <<EOF
ç”¨æ³•: $0 [é€‰é¡¹]
é€‰é¡¹:
  --edition <official|trial>  æŒ‡å®šæ‰“åŒ…ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼ˆé»˜è®¤ officialï¼‰
  --clean-only               ä»…æ¸…ç†æ„å»ºç›®å½•åé€€å‡º
  --no-dmg                   ä¸ç”Ÿæˆ DMG å®‰è£…åŒ…
  --help                     æ˜¾ç¤ºæœ¬å¸®åŠ©
EOF
}

EDITION="official"
CREATE_DMG_FLAG=true
CLEAN_ONLY=false

while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case "$1" in
        --edition)
            EDITION="${2:-official}"
            shift 2
            ;;
        --clean-only)
            CLEAN_ONLY=true
            shift
            ;;
        --no-dmg)
            CREATE_DMG_FLAG=false
            shift
            ;;
        --help)
            usage
            exit 0
            ;;
        *)
            echo "æœªçŸ¥é€‰é¡¹: $1"
            usage
            exit 1
            ;;
    esac
done

case "$EDITION" in
    official)
        EDITION_LABEL="æ­£å¼ç‰ˆ"
        CONFIG_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/config_api_production.py"
        # ç›´æ¥ä½¿ç”¨ç°æœ‰é«˜æ¸… icns å›¾æ ‡ï¼ˆ674Kï¼Œå¤šå°ºå¯¸ï¼‰
        ICON_TARGET="$PACKAGING_DIR/app_icon.icns"
        BUNDLE_ID="com.gemeng.ai"
        ;;
    trial)
        EDITION_LABEL="ä½“éªŒç‰ˆ"
        CONFIG_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/config_api_trial.py"
        ICON_SOURCE_PNG="$PROJECT_ROOT/Godreamå›¾æ ‡ï¼ˆTç‰ˆï¼‰.png"
        ICON_FALLBACK_ICNS="$PACKAGING_DIR/godream_trial.icns"
        BUNDLE_ID="com.gemeng.ai.trial"
        ;;
    *)
        echo "âš ï¸ æœªçŸ¥çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬ç±»å‹: $EDITION"
        exit 1
        ;;
esac

APP_PACKAGE_NAME="${APP_NAME}_v${APP_VERSION}_${EDITION_LABEL}"
FINAL_APP_PATH="$DIST_DIR/${APP_PACKAGE_NAME}.app"
RELEASE_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/release/macos/$EDITION"
CONFIG_BACKUP="$PROJECT_ROOT/config_api.py.backup_for_macos_packaging"
ICON_TARGET="$PACKAGING_DIR/app_icon.icns"

ensure_command() {
    if ! command -v "$1" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "âŒ æœªæ‰¾åˆ°å‘½ä»¤: $1"
        exit 1
    fi
}

check_requirements() {
    echo "ğŸ” æ£€æŸ¥ç¯å¢ƒ..."
    if [[ "$OSTYPE" != "darwin"* ]]; then
        echo "âŒ æ­¤è„šæœ¬ä»…æ”¯æŒåœ¨ macOS ä¸Šè¿è¡Œ"
        exit 1
    fi
    ensure_command python3
    ensure_command pip3
    ensure_command sips
    ensure_command iconutil
    ensure_command rsync

    if [[ "$(uname -m)" != "arm64" ]]; then
        echo "âš ï¸ å½“å‰è„šæœ¬ä»…éªŒè¯è¿‡ Apple Silicon (arm64) å¹³å°ï¼ŒIntel è®¾å¤‡å¯èƒ½å‡ºç°å…¼å®¹æ€§é—®é¢˜ã€‚"
    fi
    echo "âœ… ç¯å¢ƒæ£€æŸ¥é€šè¿‡"
}

install_dependencies() {
    if [[ "${SKIP_PIP_INSTALL:-0}" == "1" ]]; then
        echo "âš ï¸ è·³è¿‡ä¾èµ–å®‰è£…ï¼ˆæ£€æµ‹åˆ° SKIP_PIP_INSTALL=1ï¼‰"
        return
    fi

    echo "ğŸ“¦ å®‰è£…æ‰“åŒ…ä¾èµ–..."
    cd "$PROJECT_ROOT"
    pip3 install --upgrade py2app dmgbuild >/dev/null

    if [[ -f "requirements_py313.txt" ]]; then
        pip3 install -r requirements_py313.txt >/dev/null
    elif [[ -f "requirements.txt" ]]; then
        pip3 install -r requirements.txt >/dev/null
    fi

    pip3 install pillow PyQt5 >/dev/null
    echo "âœ… ä¾èµ–å®‰è£…å®Œæˆ"
}

clean_build() {
    echo "ğŸ§¹ æ¸…ç†æ„å»ºç›®å½•..."
    rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR" "$DIST_DIR" "$DMG_DIR"
    echo "âœ… æ¸…ç†å®Œæˆ"
}

prepare_config() {
    if [[ ! -f "$CONFIG_SOURCE" ]]; then
        echo "âŒ æ‰¾ä¸åˆ°é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶: $CONFIG_SOURCE"
        exit 1
    fi
    cp "$PROJECT_ROOT/config_api.py" "$CONFIG_BACKUP" 2>/dev/null || true
    cp "$CONFIG_SOURCE" "$PROJECT_ROOT/config_api.py"
    echo "âœ… å·²åˆ‡æ¢é…ç½®åˆ°: $(basename "$CONFIG_SOURCE")"
}

prepare_platform_resources() {
    if [[ ! -d "$RESOURCES_DIR" ]]; then
        return
    fi
    local backup_parent
    backup_parent="$(mktemp -d)"
    RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR="$backup_parent/resources_backup"
    mkdir -p "$RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR"
    rsync -a "$RESOURCES_DIR/" "$RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR"/ >/dev/null 2>&1

    local stage_parent
    stage_parent="$(mktemp -d)"
    local stage_dir="$stage_parent/resources"
    mkdir -p "$stage_dir"
    rsync -a "$RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR"/ "$stage_dir"/ >/dev/null 2>&1

    # ä»…ä¿ç•™ macOS æ‰€éœ€äºŒè¿›åˆ¶
    if [[ -d "$stage_dir/bin/windows" ]]; then
        rm -rf "$stage_dir/bin/windows"
    fi

    rm -rf "$RESOURCES_DIR"
    mv "$stage_dir" "$RESOURCES_DIR"
    rm -rf "$stage_parent"
}

restore_platform_resources() {
    if [[ -n "$RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR" && -d "$RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR" ]]; then
        local backup_parent
        backup_parent="$(dirname "$RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR")"
        rm -rf "$RESOURCES_DIR"
        mv "$RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR" "$RESOURCES_DIR"
        rm -rf "$backup_parent" 2>/dev/null || true
        RESOURCE_BACKUP_DIR=""
    fi
}

cleanup_on_exit() {
    if [[ -f "$CONFIG_BACKUP" ]]; then
        mv "$CONFIG_BACKUP" "$PROJECT_ROOT/config_api.py"
        echo "ğŸ” å·²æ¢å¤ config_api.py"
    fi
    restore_platform_resources
    rm -rf "$TEMP_ICON_DIR" 2>/dev/null || true
}

generate_app_icon() {
    local source_png="$ICON_SOURCE_PNG"
    if [[ ! -f "$source_png" ]]; then
        echo "âŒ æ‰¾ä¸åˆ°å›¾æ ‡æºæ–‡ä»¶: $source_png"
        exit 1
    fi

    if ! python3 -m icnsutil --version >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "âŒ æœªå®‰è£… icnsutilï¼Œè¯·å…ˆæ‰§è¡Œ: python3 -m pip install icnsutil"
        exit 1
    fi

    TEMP_ICON_DIR="$(mktemp -d)"
    local iconset_dir="$TEMP_ICON_DIR/Iconset"
    mkdir -p "$iconset_dir"

    declare -a base_sizes=(16 32 128 256 512)
    local -a compose_args=()
    for size in "${base_sizes[@]}"; do
        local base_file="$iconset_dir/icon_${size}x${size}.png"
        sips -z "$size" "$size" "$source_png" --out "$base_file" >/dev/null
        compose_args+=("$base_file")

        local retina=$((size * 2))
        local retina_file="$iconset_dir/icon_${size}x${size}@2x.png"
        sips -z "$retina" "$retina" "$source_png" --out "$retina_file" >/dev/null
        compose_args+=("$retina_file")
    done

    if ! python3 -m icnsutil compose -f "$ICON_TARGET" "${compose_args[@]}"; then
        echo "âŒ icnsutil ç”Ÿæˆå›¾æ ‡å¤±è´¥: $ICON_TARGET"
        exit 1
    fi

    echo "âœ… å·²ç”Ÿæˆ macOS å›¾æ ‡: $ICON_TARGET"
}

build_app() {
    echo "ğŸ”¨ å¼€å§‹æ„å»º ${EDITION_LABEL} ..."
    cd "$PROJECT_ROOT"

    export GEMENG_APP_EDITION="$EDITION"
    export GEMENG_APP_NAME="$APP_NAME"
    export GEMENG_APP_VERSION="$APP_VERSION"
    export GEMENG_APP_BUNDLE_ID="$BUNDLE_ID"
    export GEMENG_APP_ICON="$ICON_TARGET"
    export ARCHFLAGS="-arch arm64"
    export MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET="${MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET:-13.0}"

    local python_bin="${PYTHON_BIN:-python3}"
    local build_status=0
    if [[ "$(uname -m)" == "arm64" ]]; then
        set +e
        arch -arm64 "$python_bin" "$PACKAGING_DIR/setup.py" py2app
        build_status=$?
        set -e
    else
        "$python_bin" "$PACKAGING_DIR/setup.py" py2app || build_status=$?
    fi
    if [[ $build_status -ne 0 ]]; then
        echo "âš ï¸ py2app è¿”å›çŠ¶æ€ $build_statusï¼Œç»§ç»­æ‰§è¡Œï¼ˆæ—¥å¿—è§ä¸Šï¼‰"
    fi

    local built_app="$DIST_DIR/$APP_NAME.app"
    if [[ ! -d "$built_app" ]]; then
        echo "âŒ æœªæ‰¾åˆ°æ„å»ºäº§ç‰©: $built_app"
        exit 1
    fi

    rm -rf "$FINAL_APP_PATH"
    mv "$built_app" "$FINAL_APP_PATH"
    echo "âœ… åº”ç”¨æ„å»ºæˆåŠŸ: $FINAL_APP_PATH"
}

fix_app_permissions() {
    echo "ğŸ”§ ä¿®å¤æƒé™..."
    find "$FINAL_APP_PATH" -type f -name "*.so" -exec chmod +x {} \;
    find "$FINAL_APP_PATH" -type f -name "*.dylib" -exec chmod +x {} \;
    local binary="$FINAL_APP_PATH/Contents/MacOS/$APP_NAME"
    if [[ -f "$binary" ]]; then
        chmod +x "$binary"
    fi
    echo "âœ… æƒé™ä¿®å¤å®Œæˆ"
}

verify_app() {
    echo "ğŸ” éªŒè¯åº”ç”¨ç»“æ„..."
    if [[ ! -f "$FINAL_APP_PATH/Contents/Info.plist" ]]; then
        echo "âŒ ç¼ºå°‘ Info.plist"
        exit 1
    fi
    if [[ ! -f "$FINAL_APP_PATH/Contents/MacOS/$APP_NAME" ]]; then
        echo "âŒ ç¼ºå°‘ä¸»æ‰§è¡Œæ–‡ä»¶"
        exit 1
    fi
    echo "âœ… ç»“æ„éªŒè¯é€šè¿‡"
}

thin_binary() {
    local binary="$FINAL_APP_PATH/Contents/MacOS/$APP_NAME"
    if [[ -f "$binary" ]]; then
        local archs
        archs="$(lipo -info "$binary" 2>/dev/null || true)"
        echo "â„¹ï¸ å½“å‰å¯æ‰§è¡Œæ¶æ„: $archs"
        echo "[$(date '+%F %T')] $APP_PACKAGE_NAME -> $archs" >> "$PROJECT_ROOT/thin_binary.log"
        if [[ "$archs" == *"Non-fat"* ]]; then
            echo "âœ… å¯æ‰§è¡Œæ–‡ä»¶å·²æ˜¯å•æ¶æ„: $archs"
            return
        fi
        if [[ "$archs" == *"arm64"* ]]; then
            echo "â†”ï¸ å»é™¤å¤šä½™æ¶æ„: $archs"
            lipo "$binary" -thin arm64 -output "${binary}.arm64"
            mv "${binary}.arm64" "$binary"
        fi
    fi
}

embed_python_runtime() {
    local python_bin="${PYTHON_BIN:-python3}"
    local framework_dir
    framework_dir="$("$python_bin" -c 'import os, sysconfig; prefix=sysconfig.get_config_var("PYTHONFRAMEWORKPREFIX"); name=sysconfig.get_config_var("PYTHONFRAMEWORK"); print(os.path.join(prefix, name + ".framework") if prefix and name else "")' 2>/dev/null)"

    if [[ -z "$framework_dir" || ! -d "$framework_dir" ]]; then
        echo "âš ï¸ æœªæ‰¾åˆ°å¯ç”¨çš„ Python.frameworkï¼Œè·³è¿‡åµŒå…¥"
        return
    fi

    local framework_name
    framework_name="$(basename "$framework_dir")"
    local target_dir="$FINAL_APP_PATH/Contents/Frameworks/$framework_name"

    mkdir -p "$FINAL_APP_PATH/Contents/Frameworks"
    rm -rf "$target_dir"
    rsync -a "$framework_dir/" "$target_dir/" >/dev/null 2>&1
    echo "âœ… å·²åµŒå…¥ Python æ¡†æ¶: $framework_name"
}

clean_app_metadata() {
    echo "ğŸ§½ æ¸…ç†æ‰©å±•å±æ€§..."
    find "$FINAL_APP_PATH" -name '.DS_Store' -delete 2>/dev/null || true
    find "$FINAL_APP_PATH" -name '._*' -delete 2>/dev/null || true
    xattr -cr "$FINAL_APP_PATH"
}

sign_app() {
    echo "âœï¸ æ‰§è¡Œ ad-hoc ç­¾å..."
    clean_app_metadata
    if ! codesign --force --deep --options runtime --sign - "$FINAL_APP_PATH"; then
        echo "âŒ codesign å¤±è´¥"
        exit 1
    fi
    if ! codesign -vv "$FINAL_APP_PATH" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "âŒ ç­¾åæ ¡éªŒå¤±è´¥"
        exit 1
    fi
    if ! spctl --assess -vv --type execute "$FINAL_APP_PATH" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        echo "â„¹ï¸ Gatekeeper ä»éœ€å³é”®â†’æ‰“å¼€æˆ–æ‰§è¡Œ 'sudo spctl --add \"$FINAL_APP_PATH\"' åå†è¿è¡Œï¼ˆæ­£å¸¸æç¤ºï¼‰"
    fi
    echo "âœ… ç­¾åä¸å±æ€§ä¿®å¤å®Œæˆ"
}

package_release() {
    mkdir -p "$RELEASE_DIR"
    local release_app="$RELEASE_DIR/${APP_PACKAGE_NAME}.app"
    local release_zip="$RELEASE_DIR/${APP_PACKAGE_NAME}.app.zip"

    rm -rf "$release_app" "$release_zip"
    cp -R "$FINAL_APP_PATH" "$release_app"
    (cd "$RELEASE_DIR" && ditto -c -k --keepParent "${APP_PACKAGE_NAME}.app" "${APP_PACKAGE_NAME}.app.zip")
    echo "âœ… äº§ç‰©å·²è¾“å‡ºè‡³: $release_app"
    echo "âœ… å‹ç¼©åŒ…: $release_zip"
}

create_dmg() {
    echo "ğŸ“¦ åˆ›å»º DMG..."
    mkdir -p "$DMG_DIR"
    rm -rf "$DMG_DIR"/*
    cp -R "$FINAL_APP_PATH" "$DMG_DIR/"
    ln -sf /Applications "$DMG_DIR/Applications"

    local dmg_path="$DIST_DIR/${APP_PACKAGE_NAME}.dmg"
    rm -f "$dmg_path"

    hdiutil create -volname "$APP_PACKAGE_NAME" \
        -srcfolder "$DMG_DIR" \
        -ov -format UDZO \
        "$dmg_path" >/dev/null

    echo "âœ… DMG åˆ›å»ºå®Œæˆ: $dmg_path"
}

main() {
    if $CLEAN_ONLY; then
        clean_build
        exit 0
    fi

    check_requirements
    install_dependencies

    # å›¾æ ‡å¤„ç†ï¼šæ­£å¼ç‰ˆç›´æ¥ä½¿ç”¨ç°æœ‰ icnsï¼Œä½“éªŒç‰ˆä» PNG ç”Ÿæˆ
    if [[ "$EDITION" == "official" ]]; then

        # æ— éœ€ç”Ÿæˆï¼ŒICON_TARGET å·²æŒ‡å‘ç°æœ‰æ–‡ä»¶
    elif [[ "$EDITION" == "trial" ]]; then
        generate_app_icon
    fi

    clean_build
    prepare_config
    prepare_platform_resources
    trap cleanup_on_exit EXIT

    build_app
    fix_app_permissions
    verify_app
    thin_binary
    embed_python_runtime
    sign_app
    package_release

    if $CREATE_DMG_FLAG; then
        create_dmg
    fi

    echo ""
    echo "ğŸ‰ ${EDITION_LABEL} æ‰“åŒ…å®Œæˆ"
    echo "   åº”ç”¨: $FINAL_APP_PATH"
    if $CREATE_DMG_FLAG; then
        echo "   DMG : $DIST_DIR/${APP_PACKAGE_NAME}.dmg"
    fi
    echo "ğŸ‘‰ æ³¨æ„ï¼šå½“å‰æ„å»ºä»…é’ˆå¯¹ Apple Silicon (arm64) è¿›è¡ŒéªŒè¯ã€‚"
}

#!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
é¸½æ¢¦AI - macOSåº”ç”¨æ‰“åŒ…é…ç½®
ä½¿ç”¨py2appå°†Pythonåº”ç”¨æ‰“åŒ…ä¸ºmacOS .appåº”ç”¨
"""

from setuptools import setup
import plistlib
import os
import sys
import importlib.util
from pathlib import Path

# ç¡®ä¿å¯¼å…¥è·¯å¾„
project_root = Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent
sys.path.insert(0, str(project_root))

# åº”ç”¨ä¿¡æ¯
default_version = "0.8.0"
version_file = project_root / "version.py"
if version_file.exists():
    try:
        spec = importlib.util.spec_from_file_location("gemeng_version", version_file)
        version_module = importlib.util.module_from_spec(spec)
        spec.loader.exec_module(version_module)  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
        default_version = getattr(version_module, "__version__", default_version)
    except Exception:
        pass

APP_NAME = os.environ.get("GEMENG_APP_NAME", "é¸½æ¢¦Godream")
APP_VERSION = os.environ.get("GEMENG_APP_VERSION", default_version)
APP_BUNDLE_ID = os.environ.get("GEMENG_APP_BUNDLE_ID", "com.gemeng.ai")
APP_MAIN_SCRIPT = str(Path(__file__).parent / "app_launcher.py")

# åˆ›å»ºInfo.plistå†…å®¹
INFO_PLIST = {
    'CFBundleName': APP_NAME,
    'CFBundleDisplayName': APP_NAME,
    'CFBundleIdentifier': APP_BUNDLE_ID,
    'CFBundleVersion': APP_VERSION,
    'CFBundleShortVersionString': APP_VERSION,
    'CFBundleExecutable': APP_NAME,
    'CFBundleIconFile': 'app_icon',
    'NSHighResolutionCapable': True,
    'LSMinimumSystemVersion': '10.14.0',
    'NSAppTransportSecurity': {
        'NSAllowsArbitraryLoads': True
    },
    'NSCameraUsageDescription': 'åº”ç”¨éœ€è¦è®¿é—®ç›¸æœºä»¥ç”Ÿæˆå›¾ç‰‡',
    'NSPhotoLibraryUsageDescription': 'åº”ç”¨éœ€è¦è®¿é—®ç…§ç‰‡åº“ä»¥ä¿å­˜ç”Ÿæˆçš„å›¾ç‰‡å’Œè§†é¢‘',
    'CFBundleDocumentTypes': [
        {
            'CFBundleTypeIconFile': 'app_icon',
            'CFBundleTypeName': 'Image Files',
            'CFBundleTypeRole': 'Viewer',
            'LSItemContentTypes': ['public.image'],
            'LSHandlerRank': 'Alternate'
        },
        {
            'CFBundleTypeIconFile': 'app_icon', 
            'CFBundleTypeName': 'Video Files',
            'CFBundleTypeRole': 'Viewer',
            'LSItemContentTypes': ['public.movie'],
            'LSHandlerRank': 'Alternate'
        }
    ]
}

# éœ€è¦åŒ…å«çš„æ•°æ®æ–‡ä»¶å’Œèµ„æº
RESOURCE_FILE_NAMES = [
    "config_api_example.py",
    ".env.example",
    "README.md",
    "LICENSE",
]

RESOURCE_FILES = [
    str(project_root / file_name)
    for file_name in RESOURCE_FILE_NAMES
    if (project_root / file_name).exists()
]

DATA_FILES = [("", RESOURCE_FILES)] if RESOURCE_FILES else []

# éœ€è¦åŒ…å«çš„åŒ…
PACKAGES = [
    'components',
    'config', 
    'modules',
    'utils',
    'docs',
    'scripts',
    'edition',
]

# éœ€è¦æ’é™¤çš„åŒ…ï¼ˆå‡å°‘ä½“ç§¯ï¼‰
EXCLUDES = [
    'matplotlib',
    'numpy.distutils',
    'numpy.tests',
    'setuptools',
    'distutils',
    'pkg_resources',
    'pip',
    'wheel',
    'pytest',
    'black',
    'flake8',
    'PyInstaller',
    'tkinter',
]

# éœ€è¦åŒ…å«çš„æ¨¡å—
INCLUDES = [
    'PyQt5.QtCore',
    'PyQt5.QtGui', 
    'PyQt5.QtWidgets',
    'PyQt5.QtNetwork',
    'requests',
    'cmath',
    'loguru',
    'pandas',
    'PIL',
    'json',
    'csv',
    'pathlib',
    'asyncio',
    'aiohttp'
]

icon_override = os.environ.get("GEMENG_APP_ICON")
default_icon_path = Path(__file__).parent / "app_icon.icns"
ICON_PATH = Path(icon_override) if icon_override else default_icon_path

# py2appé€‰é¡¹
OPTIONS = {
    'py2app': {
        'dist_dir': str(project_root / "dist"),
        'bdist_base': str(project_root / "build"),
        'optimize': 2,
        'compressed': True,
        'semi_standalone': False,
        'site_packages': True,
        'strip': False,
        'iconfile': str(ICON_PATH),
        'plist': INFO_PLIST,
        'packages': PACKAGES,
        'includes': INCLUDES,
        'excludes': EXCLUDES,
        'resources': [
            str(project_root / "components"),
            str(project_root / "modules"), 
            str(project_root / "utils"),
            str(project_root / "config"),
            str(project_root / "edition" / "resources"),
        ],
        'qt_plugins': [
            'platforms',
            'styles',
            'imageformats',
            'iconengines',
            'platforminputcontexts',
            'printsupport',
        ],
        'argv_emulation': False,
        'use_pythonpath': True,
        'alias': False,
        'debug_modulegraph': False,
        'debug_skip_macholib': False,
        'matplotlib_backends': [],
    }
}

setup(
    name=APP_NAME,
    version=APP_VERSION,
    description="é¸½æ¢¦Godream - AIå†…å®¹ç”Ÿæˆå·¥å…·",
    author="é¸½æ¢¦å¼€å‘å›¢é˜Ÿ",
    url="https://github.com/gemeng/ai",
    
    # ä¸»åº”ç”¨è„šæœ¬
    app=[APP_MAIN_SCRIPT],
    
    # æ•°æ®æ–‡ä»¶
    data_files=DATA_FILES,
    
    # æ‰“åŒ…é€‰é¡¹
    options=OPTIONS,
    
    # ä¾èµ–è®¾ç½®
    setup_requires=['py2app'],
    
    # åŒ…å«æ‰€æœ‰å­åŒ…
    packages=PACKAGES,
    package_dir={'': str(project_root)},
    
    # Pythonè¦æ±‚
    python_requires='>=3.7',
)

   - The setup.py uses `from setuptools import setup` and `py2app` options
   - The script runs: `python3 packaging/macos/setup.py py2app`

4. **Build Execution**:

   - App size: **2.1GB** (user says this is too large, should be hundreds of MB)

   - The script's signing step failed due to `com.apple.provenance` extended attributes

   - Multiple attempts to clear xattr failed:

     - `find ... -exec xattr -c {} \;` didn't work
     - `ditto --norsrc` didn't work
     - `zip/unzip` approach was attempted but still running

6. **User's Final Message (Critical)**:
   - User says the package is too large (2.1GB) - should be only hundreds of MB
   - User indicates the packaging method should be **PyInstaller**, not py2app
   - The existing build script uses py2app, which the user is questioning

Key files examined:

- `/Users/yunchang/Documents/GitHub/gemeng2/packaging/macos/build_app.sh` - build script using py2app

   - **py2app**: The current build script uses py2app (which the user is questioning)
   - **PyInstaller**: What the user says should be used instead

import subprocess

def clean_build_dirs():

    icon_files = [

1â†’"""Watermark utilities for GoDream trial edition."""
     2â†’
     3â†’from __future__ import annotations
     4â†’
     5â†’import logging
     6â†’import os
     7â†’import shlex
     8â†’import shutil
     9â†’import subprocess
    10â†’import tempfile
    11â†’from pathlib import Path
    12â†’from typing import Optional
    13â†’
    14â†’from PIL import Image, ImageDraw, ImageFont
    15â†’
    16â†’from .resources import resolve_font_path, resolve_ffmpeg_binary, ensure_ascii_font_path
    17â†’
    18â†’try:  # pragma: no cover - é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶å¯èƒ½åœ¨éƒ¨åˆ†ç¯å¢ƒç¼ºå¤±
    19â†’    from config_api import LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG  # type: ignore
    20â†’except Exception:  # pragma: no cover
    21â†’    LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG = {
    22â†’        "enabled": False,
    23â†’        "text": "",
    24â†’        "opacity": 0.0,
    25â†’        "position": "bottom_right",
    26â†’        "font_size": 0,
    27â†’    }
    28â†’
    29â†’LOGGER = logging.getLogger("WatermarkService")
    30â†’
    31â†’
    32â†’class WatermarkService:
    33â†’    """Applies fixed text watermarks to images and videos."""
    34â†’
    35â†’    def __init__(self, text: str, opacity: float = 0.3):
    36â†’        self.text = text
    37â†’        self.opacity = max(0.0, min(opacity, 1.0))
    38â†’        raw_font_path = resolve_font_path()
    39â†’        self._font_path: Optional[Path] = None
    40â†’        if raw_font_path:
    41â†’            self._font_path = ensure_ascii_font_path(Path(raw_font_path))
    42â†’        if self._font_path:
    43â†’            LOGGER.debug("Watermark font resolved: %s", self._font_path)
    44â†’        else:
    45â†’            LOGGER.warning("Watermark font not found, falling back to default glyphs")
    46â†’
    47â†’    # Image watermark -----------------------------------------------------
    48â†’    def apply_to_image(self, image_path: Path) -> bool:
    49â†’        try:
    50â†’            image_path = Path(image_path)
    51â†’            if not image_path.exists():
    52â†’                LOGGER.warning("Image path does not exist: %s", image_path)
    53â†’                return False
    54â†’
    55â†’            with Image.open(image_path).convert("RGBA") as base_image:
    56â†’                watermark_layer = self._build_image_watermark_layer(base_image)
    57â†’                composed = Image.alpha_composite(base_image, watermark_layer)
    58â†’                composed = composed.convert("RGB")
    59â†’                composed.save(image_path, quality=95)
    60â†’
    61â†’            return True
    62â†’        except Exception as exc:  # pylint: disable=broad-except
    63â†’            LOGGER.exception("Failed to apply image watermark: %s", exc)
    64â†’            return False
    65â†’
    66â†’    def _build_image_watermark_layer(self, base_image: Image.Image) -> Image.Image:
    67â†’        width, height = base_image.size
    68â†’        layer = Image.new("RGBA", base_image.size, (0, 0, 0, 0))
    69â†’        draw = ImageDraw.Draw(layer)
    70â†’
    71â†’        font_size = max(int(min(width, height) * 0.12), 48)
    72â†’        font = self._load_font(font_size)
    73â†’
    74â†’        bbox = draw.textbbox((0, 0), self.text, font=font)
    75â†’        text_width = bbox[2] - bbox[0]
    76â†’        text_height = bbox[3] - bbox[1]
    77â†’
    78â†’        target_y = int(height * 0.25 - text_height / 2)
    79â†’        target_y = max(target_y, 0)
    80â†’        target_x = int(width / 2 - text_width / 2)
    81â†’        target_x = max(target_x, 0)
    82â†’
    83â†’        draw.text(
    84â†’            (target_x, target_y),
    85â†’            self.text,
    86â†’            fill=(255, 255, 255, int(255 * self.opacity)),
    87â†’            font=font,
    88â†’        )
    89â†’
    90â†’        return layer
    91â†’
    92â†’    # Video watermark -----------------------------------------------------
    93â†’    def apply_to_video(self, video_path: Path) -> bool:
    94â†’        video_path = Path(video_path)
    95â†’        if not video_path.exists():
    96â†’            LOGGER.warning("Video path does not exist: %s", video_path)
    97â†’            return False
    98â†’
    99â†’        ffmpeg_binary = resolve_ffmpeg_binary() or shutil.which(os.environ.get("FFMPEG_BINARY", "ffmpeg"))
   100â†’        # On Windows, ignore non-.exe files (e.g., macOS/Linux binaries accidentally packaged)
   101â†’        try:
   102â†’            if os.name == "nt" and ffmpeg_binary and str(ffmpeg_binary).lower().endswith("\\ffmpeg"):
   103â†’                ffmpeg_binary = shutil.which("ffmpeg")
   104â†’        except Exception:
   105â†’            pass
   106â†’        if not ffmpeg_binary:
   107â†’            LOGGER.warning("ffmpeg binary not found, skipping video watermark")
   108â†’            return False
   109â†’        else:
   110â†’            LOGGER.debug("Using ffmpeg binary for watermark: %s", ffmpeg_binary)
   111â†’
   112â†’        # å¤„ç†é ASCII æºè§†é¢‘è·¯å¾„ï¼šæ‹·è´åˆ°ä¸´æ—¶ ASCII è·¯å¾„åå†å¤„ç†
   113â†’        def _is_ascii(s: str) -> bool:
   114â†’            try:
   115â†’                s.encode("ascii")
   116â†’                return True
   117â†’            except UnicodeEncodeError:
   118â†’                return False
   119â†’
   120â†’        temp_output: Optional[Path] = None
   121â†’        temp_input: Optional[Path] = None
   122â†’        try:
   123â†’            with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(suffix=video_path.suffix, delete=False) as tmp_file:
   124â†’                temp_output = Path(tmp_file.name)
   125â†’
   126â†’            src_input = video_path
   127â†’            if not _is_ascii(str(video_path)):
   128â†’                try:
   129â†’                    with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(suffix=video_path.suffix, delete=False) as tmp_in:
   130â†’                        temp_input = Path(tmp_in.name)
   131â†’                    shutil.copy2(video_path, temp_input)
   132â†’                    src_input = temp_input
   133â†’                    LOGGER.debug("Using ASCII temp input for watermark: %s", src_input)
   134â†’                except Exception as e:
   135â†’                    LOGGER.warning("Failed to prepare ASCII temp input: %s", e)
   136â†’
   137â†’            # ä¸æŒ‡å®šå­—ä½“æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œè®© ffmpeg ä½¿ç”¨ç³»ç»Ÿé»˜è®¤å­—ä½“
   138â†’            # åŸå› ï¼šWindows è·¯å¾„ä¸­çš„å†’å·åœ¨ ffmpeg æ»¤é•œå‚æ•°ä¸­è½¬ä¹‰å¤æ‚ï¼Œå®¹æ˜“å¤±è´¥
   139â†’            LOGGER.debug("Using system default font for video watermark")
   140â†’            LOGGER.debug("ASCII input path: %s; using temp: %s", _is_ascii(str(video_path)), bool(temp_input))
   141â†’            option_pairs = {
   142â†’                "text": self.text,
   143â†’                "x": "(w-text_w)/2",
   144â†’                "y": "h/4",
   145â†’                "fontsize": "min(w,h)/10",
   146â†’                "fontcolor": f"white@{self.opacity}",
   147â†’            }
   148â†’            drawtext_options = [f"{key}={self._escape_text(value)}" for key, value in option_pairs.items()]
   149â†’            drawtext_filter = "drawtext=" + ":".join(drawtext_options)
   150â†’
   151â†’            # ä¼˜å…ˆå°è¯• libx264 + yuv420pï¼Œå¤±è´¥åˆ™å›é€€é»˜è®¤ç¼–ç 
   152â†’            def _run_ffmpeg(args: list[str]) -> subprocess.CompletedProcess:
   153â†’                LOGGER.info("Applying video watermark with ffmpeg: %s", " ".join(shlex.quote(c) for c in args))
   154â†’                return subprocess.run(args, check=False, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE)
   155â†’
   156â†’            cmd_common = [
   157â†’                str(ffmpeg_binary),
   158â†’                "-y",
   159â†’                "-i",
   160â†’                str(src_input),
   161â†’                "-vf",
   162â†’                drawtext_filter,
   163â†’                "-codec:a",
   164â†’                "copy",
   165â†’            ]
   166â†’
   167â†’            cmd_try1 = cmd_common + ["-c:v", "libx264", "-pix_fmt", "yuv420p", str(temp_output)]
   168â†’            result = _run_ffmpeg(cmd_try1)
   169â†’            if result.returncode != 0:
   170â†’                stderr1 = result.stderr.decode("utf-8", errors="ignore")
   171â†’                LOGGER.warning("ffmpeg watermark try1 failed (code %s): %s", result.returncode, stderr1[:400])
   172â†’                # å›é€€åˆ°é»˜è®¤ç¼–ç ï¼ˆä¸æŒ‡å®š -c:vï¼‰
   173â†’                cmd_try2 = cmd_common + [str(temp_output)]
   174â†’                result = _run_ffmpeg(cmd_try2)
   175â†’                if result.returncode != 0:
   176â†’                    stderr2 = result.stderr.decode("utf-8", errors="ignore")
   177â†’                    # æŠ¥å‘Šç–‘ä¼¼ç¼ºå°‘ drawtext æˆ–å­—ä½“é—®é¢˜
   178â†’                    if "No such filter: 'drawtext'" in stderr2 or "No such filter: 'drawtext'" in stderr1:
   179â†’                        LOGGER.error("ffmpeg build does not include drawtext filter; cannot apply watermark")
   180â†’                    else:
   181â†’                        LOGGER.warning("ffmpeg watermark try2 failed (code %s): %s", result.returncode, stderr2[:400])
   182â†’                    temp_output.unlink(missing_ok=True)
   183â†’                    return False
   184â†’
   185â†’            # è¦†ç›–æºæ–‡ä»¶
   186â†’            temp_output.replace(video_path)
   187â†’            return True
   188â†’        except Exception as exc:  # pylint: disable=broad-except
   189â†’            LOGGER.exception("Failed to apply video watermark: %s", exc)
   190â†’            return False
   191â†’        finally:
   192â†’            if temp_output and temp_output.exists():
   193â†’                try:
   194â†’                    temp_output.unlink(missing_ok=True)
   195â†’                except Exception:
   196â†’                    pass
   197â†’            if temp_input and temp_input.exists():
   198â†’                try:
   199â†’                    temp_input.unlink(missing_ok=True)
   200â†’                except Exception:
   201â†’                    pass
   202â†’
   203â†’    # Helpers -------------------------------------------------------------
   204â†’    def _load_font(self, font_size: int) -> ImageFont.FreeTypeFont:
   205â†’        font_candidates = []
   206â†’        if self._font_path:
   207â†’            font_candidates.append(self._font_path)
   208â†’        font_candidates.extend(filter(None, self._font_fallbacks()))
   209â†’
   210â†’        for font_path in font_candidates:
   211â†’            try:
   212â†’                return ImageFont.truetype(str(font_path), font_size)
   213â†’            except OSError:
   214â†’                continue
   215â†’        return ImageFont.load_default()
   216â†’
   217â†’    @staticmethod
   218â†’    def _escape_text(value: str) -> str:
   219â†’        return (
   220â†’            value.replace("\\", "\\\\")
   221â†’            .replace(":", "\\:")
   222â†’            .replace(",", "\\,")
   223â†’            .replace("'", "\\'")
   224â†’        )
   225â†’
   226â†’    @staticmethod
   227â†’    def _resolve_font() -> Optional[str]:
   228â†’        path = resolve_font_path()
   229â†’        if not path:
   230â†’            return None
   231â†’        ascii_path = ensure_ascii_font_path(Path(path))
   232â†’        return str(ascii_path)
   233â†’
   234â†’    @staticmethod
   235â†’    def _font_fallbacks() -> list[Path]:
   236â†’        fallback_paths = [
   237â†’            Path("/System/Library/Fonts/PingFang.ttc"),
   238â†’            Path("/System/Library/Fonts/Supplemental/SourceHanSansCN-Regular.otf"),
   239â†’            Path("/Library/Fonts/PingFang.ttc"),
   240â†’            Path("/Library/Fonts/Arial Unicode.ttf"),
   241â†’            Path("C:/Windows/Fonts/msyh.ttc"),

"""Watermark utilities for GoDream trial edition."""

from __future__ import annotations

import logging
import os
import shlex
import shutil
import subprocess
import tempfile
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Optional

from PIL import Image, ImageDraw, ImageFont

from .resources import resolve_font_path, resolve_ffmpeg_binary, ensure_ascii_font_path

try:  # pragma: no cover - é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶å¯èƒ½åœ¨éƒ¨åˆ†ç¯å¢ƒç¼ºå¤±
    from config_api import LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG  # type: ignore
except Exception:  # pragma: no cover
    LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG = {
        "enabled": False,
        "text": "",
        "opacity": 0.0,
        "position": "bottom_right",
        "font_size": 0,
    }

LOGGER = logging.getLogger("WatermarkService")


class WatermarkService:
    """Applies fixed text watermarks to images and videos."""

    def __init__(self, text: str, opacity: float = 0.3):
        self.text = text
        self.opacity = max(0.0, min(opacity, 1.0))
        raw_font_path = resolve_font_path()
        self._font_path: Optional[Path] = None
        if raw_font_path:
            self._font_path = ensure_ascii_font_path(Path(raw_font_path))
        if self._font_path:
            LOGGER.debug("Watermark font resolved: %s", self._font_path)
        else:
            LOGGER.warning("Watermark font not found, falling back to default glyphs")

    # Image watermark -----------------------------------------------------
    def apply_to_image(self, image_path: Path) -> bool:
        try:
            image_path = Path(image_path)
            if not image_path.exists():
                LOGGER.warning("Image path does not exist: %s", image_path)
                return False

            with Image.open(image_path).convert("RGBA") as base_image:
                watermark_layer = self._build_image_watermark_layer(base_image)
                composed = Image.alpha_composite(base_image, watermark_layer)
                composed = composed.convert("RGB")
                composed.save(image_path, quality=95)

            return True
        except Exception as exc:  # pylint: disable=broad-except
            LOGGER.exception("Failed to apply image watermark: %s", exc)
            return False

    def _build_image_watermark_layer(self, base_image: Image.Image) -> Image.Image:
        width, height = base_image.size
        layer = Image.new("RGBA", base_image.size, (0, 0, 0, 0))
        draw = ImageDraw.Draw(layer)

        font_size = max(int(min(width, height) * 0.12), 48)
        font = self._load_font(font_size)

        bbox = draw.textbbox((0, 0), self.text, font=font)
        text_width = bbox[2] - bbox[0]
        text_height = bbox[3] - bbox[1]

        target_y = int(height * 0.25 - text_height / 2)
        target_y = max(target_y, 0)
        target_x = int(width / 2 - text_width / 2)
        target_x = max(target_x, 0)

        draw.text(
            (target_x, target_y),
            self.text,
            fill=(255, 255, 255, int(255 * self.opacity)),
            font=font,
        )

        return layer

    # Video watermark -----------------------------------------------------
    def apply_to_video(self, video_path: Path) -> bool:
        video_path = Path(video_path)
        if not video_path.exists():
            LOGGER.warning("Video path does not exist: %s", video_path)
            return False

        ffmpeg_binary = resolve_ffmpeg_binary() or shutil.which(os.environ.get("FFMPEG_BINARY", "ffmpeg"))
        # On Windows, ignore non-.exe files (e.g., macOS/Linux binaries accidentally packaged)
        try:
            if os.name == "nt" and ffmpeg_binary and str(ffmpeg_binary).lower().endswith("\\ffmpeg"):
                ffmpeg_binary = shutil.which("ffmpeg")
        except Exception:
            pass
        if not ffmpeg_binary:
            LOGGER.warning("ffmpeg binary not found, skipping video watermark")
            return False
        else:
            LOGGER.debug("Using ffmpeg binary for watermark: %s", ffmpeg_binary)

        # å¤„ç†é ASCII æºè§†é¢‘è·¯å¾„ï¼šæ‹·è´åˆ°ä¸´æ—¶ ASCII è·¯å¾„åå†å¤„ç†
        def _is_ascii(s: str) -> bool:
            try:
                s.encode("ascii")
                return True
            except UnicodeEncodeError:
                return False

        temp_output: Optional[Path] = None
        temp_input: Optional[Path] = None
        try:
            with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(suffix=video_path.suffix, delete=False) as tmp_file:
                temp_output = Path(tmp_file.name)

            src_input = video_path
            if not _is_ascii(str(video_path)):
                try:
                    with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(suffix=video_path.suffix, delete=False) as tmp_in:
                        temp_input = Path(tmp_in.name)
                    shutil.copy2(video_path, temp_input)
                    src_input = temp_input
                    LOGGER.debug("Using ASCII temp input for watermark: %s", src_input)
                except Exception as e:
                    LOGGER.warning("Failed to prepare ASCII temp input: %s", e)

            # ä¸æŒ‡å®šå­—ä½“æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œè®© ffmpeg ä½¿ç”¨ç³»ç»Ÿé»˜è®¤å­—ä½“
            # åŸå› ï¼šWindows è·¯å¾„ä¸­çš„å†’å·åœ¨ ffmpeg æ»¤é•œå‚æ•°ä¸­è½¬ä¹‰å¤æ‚ï¼Œå®¹æ˜“å¤±è´¥
            LOGGER.debug("Using system default font for video watermark")
            LOGGER.debug("ASCII input path: %s; using temp: %s", _is_ascii(str(video_path)), bool(temp_input))
            option_pairs = {
                "text": self.text,
                "x": "(w-text_w)/2",
                "y": "h/4",
                "fontsize": "min(w,h)/10",
                "fontcolor": f"white@{self.opacity}",
            }
            drawtext_options = [f"{key}={self._escape_text(value)}" for key, value in option_pairs.items()]
            drawtext_filter = "drawtext=" + ":".join(drawtext_options)

            # ä¼˜å…ˆå°è¯• libx264 + yuv420pï¼Œå¤±è´¥åˆ™å›é€€é»˜è®¤ç¼–ç 
            def _run_ffmpeg(args: list[str]) -> subprocess.CompletedProcess:
                LOGGER.info("Applying video watermark with ffmpeg: %s", " ".join(shlex.quote(c) for c in args))
                return subprocess.run(args, check=False, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE)

            cmd_common = [
                str(ffmpeg_binary),
                "-y",
                "-i",
                str(src_input),
                "-vf",
                drawtext_filter,
                "-codec:a",
                "copy",
            ]

            cmd_try1 = cmd_common + ["-c:v", "libx264", "-pix_fmt", "yuv420p", str(temp_output)]
            result = _run_ffmpeg(cmd_try1)
            if result.returncode != 0:
                stderr1 = result.stderr.decode("utf-8", errors="ignore")
                LOGGER.warning("ffmpeg watermark try1 failed (code %s): %s", result.returncode, stderr1[:400])
                # å›é€€åˆ°é»˜è®¤ç¼–ç ï¼ˆä¸æŒ‡å®š -c:vï¼‰
                cmd_try2 = cmd_common + [str(temp_output)]
                result = _run_ffmpeg(cmd_try2)
                if result.returncode != 0:
                    stderr2 = result.stderr.decode("utf-8", errors="ignore")
                    # æŠ¥å‘Šç–‘ä¼¼ç¼ºå°‘ drawtext æˆ–å­—ä½“é—®é¢˜
                    if "No such filter: 'drawtext'" in stderr2 or "No such filter: 'drawtext'" in stderr1:
                        LOGGER.error("ffmpeg build does not include drawtext filter; cannot apply watermark")
                    else:
                        LOGGER.warning("ffmpeg watermark try2 failed (code %s): %s", result.returncode, stderr2[:400])
                    temp_output.unlink(missing_ok=True)
                    return False

            # è¦†ç›–æºæ–‡ä»¶
            temp_output.replace(video_path)
            return True
        except Exception as exc:  # pylint: disable=broad-except
            LOGGER.exception("Failed to apply video watermark: %s", exc)
            return False
        finally:
            if temp_output and temp_output.exists():
                try:
                    temp_output.unlink(missing_ok=True)
                except Exception:
                    pass
            if temp_input and temp_input.exists():
                try:
                    temp_input.unlink(missing_ok=True)
                except Exception:
                    pass

    # Helpers -------------------------------------------------------------
    def _load_font(self, font_size: int) -> ImageFont.FreeTypeFont:
        font_candidates = []
        if self._font_path:
            font_candidates.append(self._font_path)
        font_candidates.extend(filter(None, self._font_fallbacks()))

        for font_path in font_candidates:
            try:
                return ImageFont.truetype(str(font_path), font_size)
            except OSError:
                continue
        return ImageFont.load_default()

    @staticmethod
    def _escape_text(value: str) -> str:
        return (
            value.replace("\\", "\\\\")
            .replace(":", "\\:")
            .replace(",", "\\,")
            .replace("'", "\\'")
        )

    @staticmethod
    def _resolve_font() -> Optional[str]:
        path = resolve_font_path()
        if not path:
            return None
        ascii_path = ensure_ascii_font_path(Path(path))
        return str(ascii_path)

    @staticmethod
    def _font_fallbacks() -> list[Path]:
        fallback_paths = [
            Path("/System/Library/Fonts/PingFang.ttc"),
            Path("/System/Library/Fonts/Supplemental/SourceHanSansCN-Regular.otf"),
            Path("/Library/Fonts/PingFang.ttc"),
            Path("/Library/Fonts/Arial Unicode.ttf"),
            Path("C:/Windows/Fonts/msyh.ttc"),
            Path("C:/Windows/Fonts/msyhbd.ttc"),
            Path("C:/Windows/Fonts/simsun.ttc"),
            Path("/usr/share/fonts/opentype/noto/NotoSansCJK-Regular.ttc"),
            Path("/usr/share/fonts/opentype/noto/NotoSansSC-Regular.otf"),
        ]
        return [p for p in fallback_paths if p.exists()]


def _watermark_settings() -> tuple[bool, str, float]:
    enabled = bool(LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG.get("enabled", False))
    text = str(LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG.get("text", ""))
    opacity = float(LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG.get("opacity", 0.0))
    opacity = max(0.0, min(opacity, 1.0))
    if enabled and not text:
        text = "PIGEON"
    return enabled, text, opacity


ENABLE_WATERMARK, WATERMARK_TEXT, WATERMARK_OPACITY = _watermark_settings()


def should_add_watermark() -> bool:
    """
    åˆ¤æ–­æ˜¯å¦åº”è¯¥æ·»åŠ æ°´å°
    
    Returns:
        bool: Trueè¡¨ç¤ºéœ€è¦æ·»åŠ æ°´å°ï¼ŒFalseè¡¨ç¤ºä¸éœ€è¦
    """
    return ENABLE_WATERMARK


def get_watermark_text() -> str:
    """
    è·å–æ°´å°æ–‡æœ¬
    
    Returns:
        str: æ°´å°æ–‡æœ¬å†…å®¹
    """
    return WATERMARK_TEXT


def get_watermark_opacity() -> float:
    """
    è·å–æ°´å°é€æ˜åº¦
    
    Returns:
        float: æ°´å°é€æ˜åº¦ (0.0-1.0)
    """
    return WATERMARK_OPACITY

1â†’#!/usr/bin/env python3
     2â†’# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
     3â†’"""
     4â†’Trial version config - watermark enabled.
     5â†’- Keep API keys empty for end users; they can set in Settings or env.
     6â†’- Force storage dir to be configured via env or raises.
     7â†’- LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG enabled for trial edition.

    10â†’import os
    11â†’from pathlib import Path
    12â†’import json
    13â†’
    14â†’VOLCENGINE_API_KEY = ""
    15â†’
    16â†’# è®¾ç½®æŒä¹…åŒ–æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆä¸ SettingsPage/ç»Ÿä¸€é…ç½®ä¿æŒä¸€è‡´ï¼‰
    17â†’_CONFIG_JSON = Path.home() / ".pigeon_dream" / "config.json"

    19â†’APP_CONFIG = {

    22â†’    "author": "AI Assistant",
    23â†’    "description": "PyQt5 local AI content tool - Trial Edition",
    24â†’}
    25â†’
    26â†’IMAGE_GENERATION_DEFAULTS = {

#!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
Trial version config - watermark enabled.
- Keep API keys empty for end users; they can set in Settings or env.
- Force storage dir to be configured via env or raises.
- LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG enabled for trial edition.
"""

import os
from pathlib import Path
import json

VOLCENGINE_API_KEY = ""

# è®¾ç½®æŒä¹…åŒ–æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆä¸ SettingsPage/ç»Ÿä¸€é…ç½®ä¿æŒä¸€è‡´ï¼‰
_CONFIG_JSON = Path.home() / ".pigeon_dream" / "config.json"

APP_CONFIG = {
    "app_name": "é¸½æ¢¦Godream ä½“éªŒç‰ˆ",
    "version": "1.2.1",
    "author": "AI Assistant",
    "description": "PyQt5 local AI content tool - Trial Edition",
}

IMAGE_GENERATION_DEFAULTS = {
    "size": "1024x1024",
    "guidance_scale": 2.5,
    "seed": -1,
    "model": "doubao-seedream-4-0-250828",
    "watermark": False,
}

VIDEO_GENERATION_DEFAULTS = {
    "duration": 4.0,
    "motion_strength": 0.8,
    "seed": -1,
    "watermark": False,
    "width": 1280,
    "height": 720,
    "fps": 24,
}

# ä½“éªŒç‰ˆï¼šå¯ç”¨æœ¬åœ°æ°´å°
LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG = {
    "enabled": True,
    "text": "äº•é¸½PIGEON",
    "opacity": 0.3,
    "position": "top_half_center",
    "font_size": 48,
}

API_WATERMARK_CONFIG = {
    "image_watermark": False,
    "video_watermark": False,
}


def validate_api_keys():
    missing = []
    if not VOLCENGINE_API_KEY:
        missing.append("VOLCENGINE_API_KEY")
    if missing:
        return False, missing, "API å¯†é’¥æœªé…ç½®"
    return True, [], "API å¯†é’¥å·²é…ç½®"


def get_storage_dir():
    # ä¼˜å…ˆï¼šç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡
    env_path = os.environ.get("GEMENG_STORAGE_DIR")
    if env_path:
        p = Path(env_path).expanduser()
        p.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        return str(p)

    # å…¶æ¬¡ï¼šç”¨æˆ·é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆSettings ä¿å­˜è·¯å¾„ï¼‰
    # ä¿®å¤ï¼šAppConfig ä¿å­˜åˆ° creation.storage_root_pathï¼Œéœ€è¦æ­£ç¡®è¯»å–åµŒå¥—ç»“æ„
    try:
        if _CONFIG_JSON.exists():
            data = json.loads(_CONFIG_JSON.read_text(encoding="utf-8") or "{}")
            # ä¼˜å…ˆä» creation åµŒå¥—ç»“æ„è¯»å–ï¼ˆä¸ AppConfig ä¿å­˜ç»“æ„ä¸€è‡´ï¼‰
            creation = data.get("creation", {})
            if isinstance(creation, dict):
                use_custom = creation.get("use_custom_storage", False)
                custom = creation.get("storage_root_path", "")
                if use_custom and custom:
                    p = Path(custom).expanduser()
                    p.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
                    return str(p)
            # å…¼å®¹æ—§ç‰ˆé¡¶å±‚é…ç½®
            custom = data.get("storage_root_path") or data.get("storage_dir")
            if custom:
                p = Path(custom).expanduser()
                p.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
                return str(p)
    except Exception:
        pass

    # æ²¡æœ‰é…ç½®åˆ™æŠ¥é”™ï¼Œå¼•å¯¼ç”¨æˆ·å»è®¾ç½®
    raise ValueError("æœªé…ç½®å­˜å‚¨è·¯å¾„ï¼Œè¯·åœ¨ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ GEMENG_STORAGE_DIR æˆ–åº”ç”¨è®¾ç½®ä¸­é…ç½®")


def get_api_key(service: str) -> str:
    s = (service or "").lower()
    key = os.environ.get("VOLCENGINE_API_KEY") or VOLCENGINE_API_KEY
    if s in {"volcengine", "volc", "ark"}:
        if not key:
            raise ValueError("ç«å±±å¼•æ“APIå¯†é’¥æœªé…ç½®ï¼Œè¯·åœ¨è®¾ç½®æˆ–ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡é…ç½®")
        return key
    raise ValueError(f"ä¸æ”¯æŒçš„æœåŠ¡: {service}")


# Trial version flag
IS_TRIAL_VERSION = True

message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Let me chronologically analyze this conversation:

1. **Initial Request (from context summary)**: User wanted to package a macOS app for distribution. They mentioned:
   - Previous packaging worked fine
   - Not an Apple developer, no official certificate
   - Wanted to check the previous v1.2.1 app at `/Users/yunchang/Downloads/Godream_v1.2.1ï¼ˆmacOSï¼‰`
   - Wanted ad-hoc signing (right-click to open bypass)

2. **First Packaging Attempt**: I used py2app via `packaging/macos/build_app.sh` which produced a 2.1GB app - user said this was wrong, should be PyInstaller producing ~hundreds of MB.

3. **PyInstaller Packaging**: 
   - Found `GoDream_macOS_Official.spec` for PyInstaller
   - Updated version from 1.2.1 to 1.2.2
   - Built in project directory but encountered `com.apple.provenance` extended attribute issues preventing signing

4. **Signing Issues**: Multiple attempts to remove provenance attributes failed:
   - `xattr -rc` didn't work
   - `ditto --norsrc` didn't work
   - `tar` copy didn't work
   - Key insight: Build in `/tmp` directory to avoid provenance attributes

5. **Successful Build**: Built in `/tmp/gemeng_build/` which worked - app size 254MB, signature successful, app launched correctly.

6. **Documentation and Commit**: Created `docs/macos/PACKAGING_GUIDE.md`, committed to git, created zip distribution.

7. **Trial Version Request**: User asked for a trial version with:
   - High-resolution trial icon
   - PIGEON watermark
   - Concern about ffmpeg for video watermarks - needs macOS version

8. **Trial Version Analysis**: I checked:
   - `GoDream_macOS_Trial.spec` exists
   - `edition/resources/bin/ffmpeg` is Mach-O 64-bit arm64 (macOS native) âœ“
   - `config_api_trial.py` has watermark enabled with text "äº•é¸½PIGEON" âœ“
   - `godream_trial_correct.icns` exists for trial icon âœ“
   - All resources ready, just need version updates

9. **Plan Created**: Updated plan file, got approval to execute trial version packaging.

Key files examined:
- `GoDream_macOS_Official.spec` - PyInstaller config for official version
- `GoDream_macOS_Trial.spec` - PyInstaller config for trial version  
- `edition/watermark_service.py` - Watermark implementation
- `edition/resources.py` - Resource resolution including ffmpeg
- `config_api_trial.py` - Trial config with watermark enabled
- `docs/macos/PACKAGING_GUIDE.md` - Created documentation

Key errors and fixes:
1. py2app produced 2.1GB instead of ~250MB â†’ Switch to PyInstaller
2. provenance attributes blocking signing â†’ Build in /tmp directory
3. Team ID mismatch on Python Framework â†’ Let PyInstaller handle signing automatically

Current state: Just exited plan mode, approved to execute trial version packaging.

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   - Package macOS v1.2.2 Official version app using PyInstaller (NOT py2app)
   - Use ad-hoc signing (right-click to open for first launch)
   - Create documentation for future reference on correct packaging method
   - Create zip distribution package
   - **Most Recent**: Package Trial version with:
     - Trial version high-resolution icon
     - "äº•é¸½PIGEON" watermark on images/videos
     - Same functionality as official version
     - Check if macOS ffmpeg is included for video watermarks

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - PyInstaller vs py2app (PyInstaller produces ~250MB, py2app produces ~2.1GB)
   - Ad-hoc code signing (`codesign --force --deep --options runtime --sign -`)
   - `com.apple.provenance` extended attributes blocking signing on macOS Ventura+
   - Building in `/tmp` directory to avoid provenance attributes
   - Mach-O arm64 binaries for Apple Silicon
   - FFmpeg for video watermark processing
   - PIL/Pillow for image watermark processing

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - **`GoDream_macOS_Official.spec`** - Updated version 1.2.1â†’1.2.2
     ```python
     name='é¸½æ¢¦Godream_v1.2.2_æ­£å¼ç‰ˆ.app',
     'CFBundleShortVersionString': '1.2.2',
     'CFBundleVersion': '1.2.2.0',
     ```
   
   - **`GoDream_macOS_Trial.spec`** - Trial version config (needs version update)
     - Uses `config_api_trial.py` with watermark enabled
     - Uses `godream_trial_correct.icns` for icon
     - Bundle ID: `com.gemeng.ai.trial`
     - Includes ffmpeg binaries in `edition/resources/bin/`
   
   - **`edition/watermark_service.py`** - Watermark implementation
     - `apply_to_image()` - PIL-based image watermark
     - `apply_to_video()` - FFmpeg-based video watermark
     - Uses `resolve_ffmpeg_binary()` to find ffmpeg
   
   - **`edition/resources.py`** - Resource resolution

        'PIL.ImageFont',
        # æ•°æ®å¤„ç†
        'pandas',
        'numpy',
        # å¼‚æ­¥æ”¯æŒ
        'aiohttp',
        'asyncio',
        # ç¯å¢ƒé…ç½®

        'pathlib',
        # é¡¹ç›®æ¨¡å—

        'edition.watermark_service',
        'edition.resources',
        'modules.config.config_manager',
        'modules.seedream.manager',

#!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
Trial version config - watermark enabled.
- Keep API keys empty for end users; they can set in Settings or env.
- Force storage dir to be configured via env or raises.
- LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG enabled for trial edition.
"""

import os
from pathlib import Path
import json

VOLCENGINE_API_KEY = ""

# è®¾ç½®æŒä¹…åŒ–æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆä¸ SettingsPage/ç»Ÿä¸€é…ç½®ä¿æŒä¸€è‡´ï¼‰
_CONFIG_JSON = Path.home() / ".pigeon_dream" / "config.json"

APP_CONFIG = {
    "app_name": "é¸½æ¢¦Godream ä½“éªŒç‰ˆ",
    "version": "1.2.1",
    "author": "AI Assistant",
    "description": "PyQt5 local AI content tool - Trial Edition",
}

IMAGE_GENERATION_DEFAULTS = {
    "size": "1024x1024",
    "guidance_scale": 2.5,
    "seed": -1,
    "model": "doubao-seedream-4-0-250828",
    "watermark": False,
}

VIDEO_GENERATION_DEFAULTS = {
    "duration": 4.0,
    "motion_strength": 0.8,
    "seed": -1,
    "watermark": False,
    "width": 1280,
    "height": 720,
    "fps": 24,
}

# ä½“éªŒç‰ˆï¼šå¯ç”¨æœ¬åœ°æ°´å°
LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG = {
    "enabled": True,
    "text": "äº•é¸½PIGEON",
    "opacity": 0.3,
    "position": "top_half_center",
    "font_size": 48,
}

API_WATERMARK_CONFIG = {
    "image_watermark": False,
    "video_watermark": False,
}


def validate_api_keys():
    missing = []
    if not VOLCENGINE_API_KEY:
        missing.append("VOLCENGINE_API_KEY")
    if missing:
        return False, missing, "API å¯†é’¥æœªé…ç½®"
    return True, [], "API å¯†é’¥å·²é…ç½®"


def get_storage_dir():
    # ä¼˜å…ˆï¼šç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡
    env_path = os.environ.get("GEMENG_STORAGE_DIR")
    if env_path:
        p = Path(env_path).expanduser()
        p.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        return str(p)

    # å…¶æ¬¡ï¼šç”¨æˆ·é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆSettings ä¿å­˜è·¯å¾„ï¼‰
    # ä¿®å¤ï¼šAppConfig ä¿å­˜åˆ° creation.storage_root_pathï¼Œéœ€è¦æ­£ç¡®è¯»å–åµŒå¥—ç»“æ„
    try:
        if _CONFIG_JSON.exists():
            data = json.loads(_CONFIG_JSON.read_text(encoding="utf-8") or "{}")
            # ä¼˜å…ˆä» creation åµŒå¥—ç»“æ„è¯»å–ï¼ˆä¸ AppConfig ä¿å­˜ç»“æ„ä¸€è‡´ï¼‰
            creation = data.get("creation", {})
            if isinstance(creation, dict):
                use_custom = creation.get("use_custom_storage", False)
                custom = creation.get("storage_root_path", "")
                if use_custom and custom:
                    p = Path(custom).expanduser()
                    p.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
                    return str(p)
            # å…¼å®¹æ—§ç‰ˆé¡¶å±‚é…ç½®
            custom = data.get("storage_root_path") or data.get("storage_dir")
            if custom:
                p = Path(custom).expanduser()
                p.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
                return str(p)
    except Exception:
        pass

    # æ²¡æœ‰é…ç½®åˆ™æŠ¥é”™ï¼Œå¼•å¯¼ç”¨æˆ·å»è®¾ç½®
    raise ValueError("æœªé…ç½®å­˜å‚¨è·¯å¾„ï¼Œè¯·åœ¨ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ GEMENG_STORAGE_DIR æˆ–åº”ç”¨è®¾ç½®ä¸­é…ç½®")


def get_api_key(service: str) -> str:
    s = (service or "").lower()
    key = os.environ.get("VOLCENGINE_API_KEY") or VOLCENGINE_API_KEY
    if s in {"volcengine", "volc", "ark"}:
        if not key:
            raise ValueError("ç«å±±å¼•æ“APIå¯†é’¥æœªé…ç½®ï¼Œè¯·åœ¨è®¾ç½®æˆ–ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡é…ç½®")
        return key
    raise ValueError(f"ä¸æ”¯æŒçš„æœåŠ¡: {service}")


# Trial version flag
IS_TRIAL_VERSION = True

#!/usr/bin/env python3
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
Trial version config - watermark enabled.
- Keep API keys empty for end users; they can set in Settings or env.
- Force storage dir to be configured via env or raises.
- LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG enabled for trial edition.
"""

import os
from pathlib import Path
import json

VOLCENGINE_API_KEY = ""

# è®¾ç½®æŒä¹…åŒ–æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆä¸ SettingsPage/ç»Ÿä¸€é…ç½®ä¿æŒä¸€è‡´ï¼‰
_CONFIG_JSON = Path.home() / ".pigeon_dream" / "config.json"

APP_CONFIG = {
    "app_name": "é¸½æ¢¦Godream ä½“éªŒç‰ˆ",
    "version": "1.2.1",
    "author": "AI Assistant",
    "description": "PyQt5 local AI content tool - Trial Edition",
}

IMAGE_GENERATION_DEFAULTS = {
    "size": "1024x1024",
    "guidance_scale": 2.5,
    "seed": -1,
    "model": "doubao-seedream-4-0-250828",
    "watermark": False,
}

VIDEO_GENERATION_DEFAULTS = {
    "duration": 4.0,
    "motion_strength": 0.8,
    "seed": -1,
    "watermark": False,
    "width": 1280,
    "height": 720,
    "fps": 24,
}

# ä½“éªŒç‰ˆï¼šå¯ç”¨æœ¬åœ°æ°´å°
LOCAL_WATERMARK_CONFIG = {
    "enabled": True,
    "text": "äº•é¸½PIGEON",
    "opacity": 0.3,
    "position": "top_half_center",
    "font_size": 48,
}

API_WATERMARK_CONFIG = {
    "image_watermark": False,
    "video_watermark": False,
}


def validate_api_keys():
    missing = []
    if not VOLCENGINE_API_KEY:
        missing.append("VOLCENGINE_API_KEY")
    if missing:
        return False, missing, "API å¯†é’¥æœªé…ç½®"
    return True, [], "API å¯†é’¥å·²é…ç½®"


def get_storage_dir():
    # ä¼˜å…ˆï¼šç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡
    env_path = os.environ.get("GEMENG_STORAGE_DIR")
    if env_path:
        p = Path(env_path).expanduser()
        p.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        return str(p)

    # å…¶æ¬¡ï¼šç”¨æˆ·é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ï¼ˆSettings ä¿å­˜è·¯å¾„ï¼‰
    # ä¿®å¤ï¼šAppConfig ä¿å­˜åˆ° creation.storage_root_pathï¼Œéœ€è¦æ­£ç¡®è¯»å–åµŒå¥—ç»“æ„
    try:
        if _CONFIG_JSON.exists():
            data = json.loads(_CONFIG_JSON.read_text(encoding="utf-8") or "{}")
            # ä¼˜å…ˆä» creation åµŒå¥—ç»“æ„è¯»å–ï¼ˆä¸ AppConfig ä¿å­˜ç»“æ„ä¸€è‡´ï¼‰
            creation = data.get("creation", {})
            if isinstance(creation, dict):
                use_custom = creation.get("use_custom_storage", False)
                custom = creation.get("storage_root_path", "")
                if use_custom and custom:
                    p = Path(custom).expanduser()
                    p.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
                    return str(p)
            # å…¼å®¹æ—§ç‰ˆé¡¶å±‚é…ç½®
            custom = data.get("storage_root_path") or data.get("storage_dir")
            if custom:
                p = Path(custom).expanduser()
                p.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
                return str(p)
    except Exception:
        pass

    # æ²¡æœ‰é…ç½®åˆ™æŠ¥é”™ï¼Œå¼•å¯¼ç”¨æˆ·å»è®¾ç½®
    raise ValueError("æœªé…ç½®å­˜å‚¨è·¯å¾„ï¼Œè¯·åœ¨ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡ GEMENG_STORAGE_DIR æˆ–åº”ç”¨è®¾ç½®ä¸­é…ç½®")


def get_api_key(service: str) -> str:
    s = (service or "").lower()
    key = os.environ.get("VOLCENGINE_API_KEY") or VOLCENGINE_API_KEY
    if s in {"volcengine", "volc", "ark"}:
        if not key:
            raise ValueError("ç«å±±å¼•æ“APIå¯†é’¥æœªé…ç½®ï¼Œè¯·åœ¨è®¾ç½®æˆ–ç¯å¢ƒå˜é‡é…ç½®")
        return key
    raise ValueError(f"ä¸æ”¯æŒçš„æœåŠ¡: {service}")


# Trial version flag
IS_TRIAL_VERSION = True
